chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas B. Selerski

records.addlTxt: Telephone scheduling conference on November 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:44 AM Defendant Nicholas B. Selerski in court.  Attorney Tsz-King Tse in court for Nicholas B. Selerski.  Attorney Jin Ho D. Pack in court for State of Wisconsin. Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 30 days mtns; tsc set; bail con't
Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:03 AM Prosecuting attorney Yolanda J. Tienstra in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nicholas B. Selerski in court.  Attorney Tsz-King Tse in court for Nicholas B. Selerski. Atty Tse states waiving Preliminary Hearing; did not complete form. Court reviews Preliminary Waiver on record. Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause; binds over to Br 1 for Arraignment.
Arraignment scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
AMENDED:  Defendant shall not use the internet except may use e-mail to communicate with people other than the victims.

3:33 PM Defendant Nicholas B. Selerski in court.  Attorney Yolanda J. Tienstra in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Tsz-King Tse in court for Nicholas B. Selerski.  Atty Tse heard on request for bond modification.  Atty Tienstra heard. Discussion held on incidental contact with minors. Parties in agreement on incidental contact.  Discussion held on use of the internet. Finds Victim Right's Compliant. State opposes contact with the victim.  Atty Tse heard on modification of cash bond. Atty Tienstra heard on objection. Court heard, Cash bond is appropriate. Request can be made in the future. Court amends bond to allow defendant to use e-mail to communicate with people other than the victims.
Motion hearing on July 25, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 068008,
Payable Number: 243494,
Receipt Number: 22R 010821,
Amount: $20.00

The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes. Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victim & their residence. No contact with minors. No use of the internet. Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin while the case is pending.

1:16 PM Intern Marco Lewis w/Prosecuting attorney Jin Ho D. Pack in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nicholas B. Selerski appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jacob Van Kerkvoorde (not eligible) appeared by video for Nicholas B. Selerski. Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, within time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets $5,000 Cash bond with conditions: The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes. Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victim & their residence. No contact with minors. No use of the internet. Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin while the case is pending.
